stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on overworld layout and gating for Parts 10-15, brainstorming how to lock the late-game beach (Part 13) and add memorable events. He models terrain in Blender, fixes a warp/collision bug, and sketches multiple micro-events (bone dragon, windmill secret, Pandora’s box).

development_findings.summary: Parts 13 and 15 (beach section) will be locked until after Bowser 2; Kaze decides to use two giant Yappy Blocks that insult the player. A Kamek overworld boss fight in Part 5 will disenchant them so they move aside and open both paths.
development_findings.quote: We need a barrier right here… evil message block that insults you and rhymes. Beat the Kamek in boss fights… then they apologize and move out of your way.

development_findings.summary: Pause menu will display a full world map that visibly ‘unrolls’ when the player presses pause.
development_findings.quote: When you open the pause menu, an animation of this type of map unrolling happens.

development_findings.summary: Secret back entrance to Course 1: a burrow in the hills leads into the windmill interior with a blue-coin switch; it exists purely as an optional Easter egg.
development_findings.quote: Adding a secret back entrance here that does nothing is kind of cool.

development_findings.summary: Volcano region will feature a giant skeletal Bone Dragon head (from Yoshi’s Story). Player punches a rotten tooth to befriend it; the dragon becomes an elevator into a rising-lava side level. Later, a goldsmith can smelt coins into a gold tooth for an extra reward/star.
development_findings.quote: He’s pissed because of a cavity… you punch his tooth, he becomes friendly… if you bring him a gold tooth he thanks you with a star.

development_findings.summary: A Pandora’s Box above Course 5 releases ‘Boobla’ ghosts; clearing them grants an overworld star.
development_findings.quote: If you open it, Booblas burst out and haunt the area. Destroy all the Booblas for a star.

development_findings.summary: World map aims for seamless exploration: every area connects without loading screens; train tracks will link early and late regions.
development_findings.quote: Everything’s connected, there’s no loading zones… it’s going to feel like a gigantic open world.

development_findings.summary: Need for structured play-testing: Kaze plans a private Discord where volunteers receive ROMs and must provide full play-through footage.
development_findings.quote: I need a reliable way to just find people willing to play my game… I look at the entire uncut footage.

development_findings.summary: Encountered a severe warp/collision bug in Area 5; suspected triangle count or misplaced warp. Current overworld draft sits at ~8,800 triangles, well within limits.
Course list confirmations: Course 10 – Lofty Lumber Leaps; Course 11 – Bowser’s Oil Tanker; Course 12 – Grand Sand Badland; Part 12 is a volcano with a fat Yoshi helper.
Side level ‘Greek garden’ by contributor Martisti will sit near Course 10 and may trigger the last overworld unlock.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy values optional secrets that simply exist for wonder, not progression.
context_findings.quote: It’s cool that it exists… that’s how video games should all be like.

context_findings.summary: Relocated to Canada in 2021; muses about U.S. taxes vs. healthcare costs.
Dislikes office environments; says being around people too long makes him ‘extremely tilted’.
context_findings.quote: I will never work in an office now. When I have people around me for too long, I get extremely tilted.

context_findings.summary: Views most online political content as rage-bait; avoids voting; jokes about being a ‘homeless schizophrenic’ politically.
Expresses fear of DMCA strikes when streaming licensed music; stops Sonic OST mid-stream.
context_findings.quote: We are gonna get so banned… okay, maybe we need to stop here.

context_findings.summary: Mentions recent funeral affecting stream schedule; next stream likely Saturday unless ‘another funeral or some shit’.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback on coin farming balance and secret entrance concepts; Kaze acknowledges suggestions.

key_stories.title: Blocking the Beach
key_stories.summary: After Bowser 2 the player could access too many zones, so Kaze brainstorms a barrier. Multiple ideas (star doors, birds) are rejected before landing on insulting Yappy Blocks disen chanted via a Kamek fight.
key_stories.challenge: Need to prevent immediate access to Parts 13/15 without invisible walls.
key_stories.process: Considered star barriers, bird NPC, hide-and-seek; settled on Kamek-enchanted message blocks.
key_stories.outcome: Plan set: two giant Yappy Blocks rhyme-insult the player; defeating Kamek turns them friendly and they move.
key_stories.key_quote: Evil message block that insults you and rhymes… after you beat Kamek they have a friendly face and move out of your way.

key_stories.title: Befriending the Bone Dragon
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants a memorable NPC in the volcano. He drafts a skeletal dragon head that initially attacks due to a rotten tooth; the player removes it, gains an elevator and optional gold-tooth quest.
key_stories.challenge: Create a unique interaction instead of another boss fight.
key_stories.process: Discussed splinters, back pain, cavities; chose tooth-punch mechanic and later goldsmith upgrade.
key_stories.outcome: Bone Dragon becomes a friend and transport; may grant star after receiving gold tooth.
key_stories.key_quote: I literally just want to befriend the bone dragon.

key_stories.title: Secret Windmill Entrance
key_stories.summary: Kaze reminisces about hidden Ocarina-style secrets and designs an optional burrow that leads into Course 1’s windmill interior with blue coins.
key_stories.challenge: Add mystery content that serves no progression purpose.
key_stories.process: Plots tunnel via Bunny Brushwoods, debates coin farming issues, confirms as Easter egg.
key_stories.outcome: Documented in design notes; will implement later.
key_stories.key_quote: Adding a secret back entrance here that does nothing is kind of cool.

open_questions.context: Kaze committed to a Kamek overworld fight that frees the Yappy Blocks but has no concrete battle design.
questions: How will Kamek attack or summon hazards?
Where exactly in Part 5 does the encounter occur?
Will it reuse existing boss systems or need new code?

open_questions.context: Concept requires punching a tooth, elevator movement, optional gold-tooth reward.
questions: What animation and hit-detection steps are needed for the dragon head?
How will the elevator ride integrate with the rising-lava side level?
What coin cost and NPC (goldsmith) will forge the tooth?

open_questions.context: Unrolling world map animation is planned but unscheduled.
questions: Who will design the 2D/3D art for the map?
Will it show collectible progress in real time?
Technical feasibility within N64 memory limits?

open_questions.context: Kaze wants a Discord-based tester pool but details unclear.
questions: How will testers be selected and managed long-term?
What legal/Nintendo precautions are in place when distributing ROMs?
What tooling will record and collect uncut playthroughs?

open_questions.context: Warp/collision in Area 5 broke; suspected triangle overload but unresolved.
questions: Are there diagnostic tools to prevent similar issues?
Could overworld polycount later exceed limits?
